title: Drawing, "Cushions for Living Room Seat, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas", 1917
medium: Graphite, color pencil on light brown wove paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper left corner: METAL PIN/ UP FRAME (all underlined); across upper half from left to right: UP FRAME/ FRONT/ METAL ANGLE TO HOLD UPHOLSTERING FRAME/ WOOD FRAME FOR BACK CUSHION (all underlined); along longitudinal axis of drawing from left to right: NO WOOD FRAME/ BACK/ 2" BOXING/ NO WOOD FRAME/ SEAT/ SEAT CUSHIONS IN THREE EQUAL DIVISIONS BY MEANS OF WELTS/ (in red pencil) NOTE DO NOT MAKE THIS SEAT FOR THE PRESENT/ PLAN OF CUSHION 12 1/2" BOXING/ NO WOOD FRAME/ THICKNESS OF CUSHION/ STUDY SEAT CUS[H]ION (all underlined); across lower left from left to right: LIVING ROOM SEAT + BACK CUS[H]ION/ PLAN OF SEAT CUSHION/ SCALE 1 1/2" = 1' 0"/ CUSHIONS FOR MR. J. ALLEN/ NIEDECKEN-WALBRIDGE CO. / INTERIOR ARCHITECTS/ ORDER # 186 (all underlined); across bottom: mohair brown stiped (?) (all underlined).
provenance: Mr. and Mrs. Robert L. Jacobson
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition and Friends of Drawings and Prints Funds
description: Elevation, cross section, plan and detail of living room seat.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Cushions for Living Room Seat, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas", 1917. Graphite, color pencil on light brown wove paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition and Friends of Drawings and Prints Funds. 1983-1-27.
